parameters:
\nc<Saki>Phew, hah, haa... He's almost here. I have to find some way
to escape...
\nc<Executive Officer>I'm back, Saki-chan. Did you wait for me?
\nc<Executive Officer>I got caught by the other officers...

\nc<Executive Officer>But thanks to that, I saw something good. I wish I could
have shown it to you, Saki-chan.

\nc<Saki>I'll go back to the company... I'll even accept being
dispatched forcefully! \bustMsgExp[1, 1]Just let me go
already!

\nc<Executive Officer>Now now, that won't do. You should be grateful, Saki-chan.
You avoided being dispatched forcefully thanks to me.

\nc<Executive Officer>What's wrong with training you the way I like? More
importantly...
\nc<Saki>(Ah... again... that... I can't take it anymore... no...)

\nc<Executive Officer>Right here we have the drug you love so much, Saki-chan.
Right?

\nc<Executive Officer>That's not good, Saki-chan. You look quite cute when you
forget how to speak... but you have to beg properly.

\nc<>As the executive officer pushes the contents of the syringe
again, Saki's attitude becomes more proactive.
\nc<>Her vacant eyes are already fixated on the syringe.

\nc<Saki>If you're going to throw it away... please inject it into
me...

\nc<Executive Officer>Wow, you became obedient so quickly. It's truly a terrifying
drug.

\nc<>The executive officer squats in front of Saki and shakes the
half-empty syringe. Saki's eyes follow the syringe slowly,
swaying like a pendulum.

\nc<Executive Officer>If I inject any more, you really won't be able to speak...
but that doesn't matter, does it?

\nc<Saki>Yes, hehe... (Right now... I must get that drug by any
means...)

\nc<Saki>For saying such insolent things... I'm sorry. I don't want
to be dispatched. I want to stay here forever with Master...
with the drug... Hehe

\nc<Executive Officer>There there, as a reward for becoming obedient, Saki gets
one drop...

\nc<>The effect of the drug is dramatic. Saki immediately starts
to tremble and clenches her teeth.

\nc<>Whether it's from anticipation and pleasure or fear doesn't
matter anymore...
\nc<Executive Officer>Good. We're going all the way today.
